---
knit: (
  function(inputFile, encoding) { 

    type_note <- "document"

    file_name <- "eamontech-course"

    title <- "Title"

    sub_title <- "Subtitle"

    rmarkdown::render( 
      input       = inputFile, 
      encoding    = encoding, 
      params =  list(title = title, sub_title = sub_title),    
      output_file = file_name)

    file.copy(inputFile, file.path(format(paste("/home/tulipbk/github/kienngynh/notebooks/",type_note,sep="")), basename(format(paste(file_name,".Rmd",sep="")))),overwrite = TRUE)})

params: 
  title:
    input: text
    label: title
    value: "Title"
  sub_title:
    input: text
    label: sub_title
    value: "Subtitle"
title: "`r params$title`"
subtitle: "`r params$sub_title`"
date: "`r format(Sys.time(),'Last complied: %B %d, %Y')`"
author: "Nguyen Huu Kien"
output: md_document
---

# Part 1: Overview

* Variable
  - Default variable in Rust is immutable
  - Syntax declare a const is: const + LETTER_UPCASE:<datatype> = value

```{extendr}

let mut x = 10;
rprintln!("x = {}", x);
x = 20;
rprintln!("x = {}", x);
const HANG_SO: u64 = 100_000_000_000;
rprintln!("HANG SO = {}", HANG_SO); 

```
